title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito remains unsigned in free agency despite 3.41 ERA and 10-4 record with Red Sox in 2025.
Garrett Crochet expresses surprise over Giolito's free agent status, citing his performance and value outplaying previous contracts.
Red Sox unlikely to re-sign Giolito after adding Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez to starting rotation for 2026.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots might pursue Colts' wide receiver Michael Pittman Jr. due to Indianapolis' potential preference for Alec Pierce.
Seahawks' edge Uchenna Nwosu is a trade target following Seattle's Super Bowl win, with a cap hit of $11.5 million.
Wide receiver Brian Thomas Jr. of the Jaguars could interest the Patriots, despite an underwhelming second season.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a 5-on-5 scrimmage but remains without a confirmed return date.
Tatum has been practicing with the Celtics and their G League affiliate as part of his rehab process.
Boston Celtics have not announced if Tatum will return this season following his Achilles tear.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC Sports' Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko delivered a memorable call for Team USA's women's hockey gold at the Milan Cortina Olympics.
During Alysa Liu's gold-winning figure skating, NBC's Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir emphasized silence to highlight her performance.
Providence led in TV ratings for Super Bowl LX, with Boston ranked third and Seattle first in share percentage.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends the free MBTA bus service on routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using remaining federal funds.
The free service began in 2022 with $8 million federal pandemic relief and costs about $340,000 monthly to run.
Mayor Wu and MBTA discuss potential future funding as city explores including the program in the next budget.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snow with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches by 7 a.m. on February 21.
Essex County saw significant snowfall with Haverhill receiving up to 5 inches by 9:45 a.m. on February 21.
A major winter storm is expected Sunday into Monday with blizzard conditions possibly causing power outages, according to the National Weather Service.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa from Canton is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor the 2013 bombing victims.
LaRosa admires her coworker Annie, who has run the marathon 24 times, as her coach and inspiration.
She hopes to find personal strength while honoring those affected by the 2013 attacks on April 15.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac, 38, sentenced to 15 months for wire fraud involving $1 million in COVID relief funds.
Kirouac misused $600,000 of Economic Injury Disaster Loans to buy Angus Lea Golf Course in Hillsborough.
Authorities found Kirouac owned four companies and misrepresented loan purposes during pandemic relief fund application.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, charged with multiple high-end shoplifting incidents in Boston, faces four counts of larceny over $1,200.
Cutelis, arrested with stolen merchandise and drugs, has theft-related offenses dating back to 2001, according to authorities.
Bail set at $2,500; Cutelis held on additional charge from New Hampshire, ordered to avoid involved stores.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will lead off for the Red Sox in the 2026 season, manager Alex Cora confirmed.
Anthony posted a .396 on-base percentage and hit .336 as the leadoff hitter over 71 games in 2025.
Willson Contreras will bat cleanup, while Trevor Story is expected to hit second for the Red Sox lineup.
